title: Blocking roads is disproportionate response to non violent protest: HRCSL
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Blocking all public roads and preventing movement is a disproportionate response to non violent protest, informs the Chairman of the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka,  Supreme Court Judge (Rtd) Rohini Marasinghe,
Furthermore, she emphasized that people have a right to protest, which is a fundamental right.
The HRCSL added that the Police can only take reasonable measures to regulate those protests.
Blocking roads is disproportionate response to non violent protest: HRCSL
Any violence will have serious repercussions for the country: BASL
